questions.question: Wular Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in Jammu and Kashmir India.
❃ It is the largest freshwater lake in India.
❃ Serves as a vital habitat for a wide variety of migratory birds.
❃ Faces environmental challenges like weed infestation and pollution.

questions.question: Dal Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Known for its scenic beauty and houseboats.
❃ The lake is popular for activities like shikara rides and water skiing.
❃ Faces issues like pollution and encroachment.

questions.question: Anchar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located near Srinagar in Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Known for its natural beauty and scenic surroundings.
❃ The lake has been shrinking due to urbanization and encroachments.

questions.question: Barinag Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Uttarakhand, India.
❃ Surrounded by lush green forests and snow-capped mountains.
❃ It is considered a sacred lake and is associated with Hindu mythology.
❃ Offers opportunities for trekking and birdwatching.

questions.question: Sheshnag Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the state of Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Situated in the Amarnath Yatra route and holds religious significance.
❃ Surrounded by snow❃capped mountains and scenic beauty.
❃ The lake freezes during winter months.

questions.question: Nagin Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated near Dal Lake in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Known for its serene beauty and tranquil atmosphere.
❃ Offers opportunities for water sports like kayaking and boating.
❃ Surrounded by the picturesque landscape of mountains and trees.

questions.question: Vishansar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the Ganderbal district of Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Surrounded by snow❃covered mountains and alpine meadows.
❃ Known for its clear blue water and scenic beauty.
❃ Popular among trekkers and adventure enthusiasts.

questions.question: Mansar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in the state of Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Known for its religious significance and considered sacred.
❃ Surrounded by lush green forests and hills.
❃ Offers boating facilities and a picturesque landscape.

questions.question: Gadsar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the Ganderbal district of Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Often referred to as the Valley of Flowers.
❃ Surrounded by alpine flowers and snow❃covered mountains.
❃ Accessible through the trekking route from Sonamarg.

questions.question: Manasbal Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Jammu and Kashmir.
❃ Known for its lotus flowers and their reflection in the water.
❃ Surrounded by lush green gardens and orchards.
❃ Offers opportunities for boating and birdwatching.

questions.question: Roopkund Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand, India.
❃ Also known as the Skeleton Lake due to the presence of human skeletons.
❃ The skeletons are believed to be from the 9th century and remain a mystery.
❃ Surrounded by snow-clad mountains and offers a popular trekking destination.

questions.question: Samiti Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in Sikkim, India.
❃ Situated at the base of Mount Kanchenjunga.
❃ Offers a picturesque view of the surrounding Himalayan peaks.
❃ Popular among trekkers and adventure enthusiasts.

questions.question: Umium Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Meghalaya, India.
❃ Also known as Barapani Lake.
❃ A reservoir created by damming the Umiam River.
❃ Offers opportunities for boating, kayaking, and water sports.

questions.question: Rudrasagar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in Tripura, India.
❃ Also known as Rudijala.
❃ Surrounded by lush greenery and picturesque landscapes.
❃ Known for its migratory birds and the famous Neermahal Palace.

questions.question: Vembanad Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Kerala, India.
❃ The longest lake in India and the largest lake in Kerala.
❃ Forms a part of the Vembanad❃Kol wetland ecosystem.
❃ Home to numerous species of flora and fauna.

questions.question: Sattal Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in the Nainital district of Uttarakhand.
❃ A group of interconnected lakes known as the Seven Lakes.
❃ Surrounded by dense forests and serves as a birdwatching paradise.
❃ Offers opportunities for camping, trekking, and nature walks.

questions.question: Surajtal Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, India.
❃ It is one of the highest lakes in India, situated at an elevation of 4,883 meters (16,020 feet).
❃ Fed by the melting glaciers and snowfields of the Bara-lacha-la pass.
❃ Offers breathtaking views of the surrounding snow-capped mountains.

questions.question: Sambhar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in the state of Rajasthan, India.
❃ The largest inland saltwater lake in India.
❃ Supports a rich ecosystem and serves as a habitat for migratory birds.
❃ The lake is a major salt production site.

questions.question: Lunkaransar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the Bikaner district of Rajasthan, India.
❃ A man-made lake built by Maharaja Lunkaran of Bikaner.
❃ Attracts a wide variety of birds, including flamingos and pelicans.
❃ Offers a peaceful environment and scenic beauty.

questions.question: Pachpadra Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in the Barmer district of Rajasthan, India.
❃ Known for its unique geological formations and saline water.
❃ The lake is surrounded by sand dunes and offers a picturesque landscape.
❃ It is a popular tourist destination for its natural beauty.

questions.question: Nakki Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the town of Mount Abu, Rajasthan, India.
❃ Known as the only artificial lake in India situated at an altitude of 1,220 meters (4,003 feet).
❃ Surrounded by hills and offers boating facilities to visitors.
❃ Has a romantic legend associated with it.

questions.question: Rajsamand Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in the Rajsamand district of Rajasthan, India.
❃ Built by Maharana Raj Singh in the 17th century.
❃ Known for its marble step-terraces and beautiful pavilions.
❃ The lake is an important pilgrimage site and hosts the annual Gangaur festival.

questions.question: Balsamand Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located near Jodhpur in Rajasthan, India.
❃ A man-made lake built in the 13th century.
❃ Surrounded by lush green gardens and fruit orchards.
❃ Offers boating facilities and serves as a popular picnic spot.

questions.question: Dhebar / Jaisamand Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Situated in Udaipur, Rajasthan, India.
❃ Known as the second-largest artificial lake in Asia.
❃ Built by Maharana Jai Singh in the 17th century.
❃ Surrounded by marble steps and has several cenotaphs on its banks.

questions.question: Pushkar Lake
questions.explanation:
❃ Located in the town of Pushkar, Rajasthan, India.
❃ Considered one of the most sacred lakes in Hindu mythology.
❃ Surrounded by 52 ghats and numerous temples.
❃ Hosts the famous Pushkar Camel Fair annually.
